channel.title: Building grand exchange database with mysql
channel.description:
hello guys, I'm trying to build a grand exchange database with php and mysql but the problem is that I searched everywhere on the net and I can not find any current item id list, I've tried to run a loop with php that checks every id from 1 to 30k on the main Runescape site but that takes way to long and it sends way to much requests to Runescape.com. Anyway I've decided to come to Moparscape community because I think you guys are the only ones who can actually help me. is there any way to get the current item id list??? if possible a list of only tradable items "which we can find on the main runescape grand exchange site"
Thanks in advance,
1414mark1414

lmfao are you high?

yes :o

item.title: Building grand exchange database with mysql
item.dc:creator: @1414mark1414 1414mark1414
item.description:
@1414mark1414 wrote:

Thanks guys for trying to help me, I finally figured it out by myself yesterday

here’s a list to download for every tradable item in Runescape and their id numbers

http://www.megaupload.com/?d=NQQC1CK5

ollie123, thanks for calling me an idiot and I think liquid magic was right I poorly explained myself

item.source: Building grand exchange database with mysql

item.title: Building grand exchange database with mysql
item.dc:creator: @Liquid_Magic Liquid Magic
item.description:
@Liquid_Magic wrote:

[quote=“Davidi2, post:5, topic:375241”]Many servers have ID lists that contain the alchemy prices (both low and high)

If you run, server sided, something that saves the item id and prices into a mySQL database once the item list is loaded, it should work for you. If you don’t know how to do that, then I don’t think you should be doing this project.

@People that say it’s not possible - It’s very possible, and not even very hard. I don’t know what you’re talking about[/quote]For the record: I never said it was impossible. He just explained it very poorly.

Read full topic
item.source: Building grand exchange database with mysql

item.title: Building grand exchange database with mysql
item.dc:creator: @davidi2 Davidi2
item.description:
@davidi2 wrote:

Many servers have ID lists that contain the alchemy prices (both low and high)

If you run, server sided, something that saves the item id and prices into a mySQL database once the item list is loaded, it should work for you. If you don’t know how to do that, then I don’t think you should be doing this project.

@People that say it’s not possible - It’s very possible, and not even very hard. I don’t know what you’re talking about

Read full topic
